document_data.title: Elminster in Myth Drannor
document_data.author: [[Ed Greenwood]]
document_data.realm year: [[240 DR|240]]{{cite book/Elminster in Myth Drannor|20|1}}–[[261 DR]]{{Cite web/Presenting...Seven Millennia of Realms Fiction}}
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Elminster in Myth Drannor''''' is the second book in the open-ended [[Elminster series]].
{{quote|''It is the time of the great elven city of [[Cormanthor (city)|Cormanthor]], when the [[Heartlands]] are home to barbarians, wicked [[dragons]] rule the skies, and the elven people trust no one. Wizards and warriors alike threaten their civilization in vain, arrogant, and ignorant quests for glory.''

''Thus it was that [[Elminster]] was guided to Cormanthor, the Towers of Song, where [[Eltargrim Irithyl|Eltargrim]] was [[Coronal]]. There he dwelt for twelve summers and more, studying with many mighty mages, learning to feel magic and know how it could be bent and directed to his will... It is recorded that when the [[Mythal]] was laid, and Cormanthor became [[Myth Drannor]], Elminster was among those who devised and spun that mighty magic.''

:– [[Antarn]] the Sage, ''The High History of Faerûnian Archmages Mighty''

''This is the eagerly awaited sequel to the best-selling ''[[Elminster: The Making of a Mage]]''. The young Elminster journeys to the legendary elven capital of Cormanthyr to learn its ways and magics despite the xenophobic foibles of the elves within. Political intrigue and otherworldly spellcraft abound in the age before the mythal was laid that became the legendary city of Myth Drannor.''}}
document_data.Summary: [[Elminster]] travels to [[Myth Drannor]]. On the way, he encounters [[Iymbryl Alastrarra]], an [[Elf|elven]] noble slain by [[Hobgoblin|hobgoblins]]. Imbryl gives him the [[Kiira]] of House [[Alastrarra]] to return to the house, which he does in the guise of an elf. His identity as a human is exposed to the elves, who want to kill him for entering Cormanthor, but he invokes the protection of [[Coronal]] [[Eltargrim Irithyl]]. Many elves begin plots against Eltargrim, Elminster, and the [[Srinshee]], especially House [[Starym]]. An elven lady named [[Symrustar Auglamyr]] flirts with Elminster, blows up several jealous suitors, and tries to dominate his mind, but he resists the spell and leaves her exposed to one of her rivals, who mutilates her. Elminster is blamed for the deaths and eventually slain, but preserved by [[Mystra]] in an incorporeal state. He becomes a slave/apprentice to [[Llombaerth Starym]], known as the Masked, along with a half-elf named [[Nacacia]]. Llombaerth tries to kill [[Mythanthar]], who is creating a mythal spell to protect the city once Eltargrim opens in, but fails. Elminster becomes Elmara to break free of his control as House Starym attempts to overthrow Eltargrim, but the coup is unsuccessful, as is an attempt to sabotage the casting of the mythal, which costs Mythanthar his life.
